data.title: Steven Fleming Share A Photo - Iron Mountain, Michigan
data.meta_description: Steven C. Fleming, 58, of Aurora, passed away Wednesday, September 4, 2013, at his home.  He was born February 10, 1955, in Coldwater, Michigan, son of Clifford and Thelma (Osborn) Fleming.   Steve graduated from Coldwater High School in 1973. While in high school, Steve was a talented student at the vocational center. He later took a position at Ferris Industries in Coldwater building campers and trailers. Steve married Teresa Corless on May 29, 1976, in Quincy, Michigan.  He worked as a carpenter for 14 years and later took a position at the local lumberyard in Coldwater. Steve along with his wife moved to Aurora in 1990.  While living in the area he worked at the Delta Do It Center in Kingsford until its closing, Hometowne Lumber from 2002-2012 and most recently at  Kingsford True Value Hardware.    Steve enjoyed the outdoors; he liked camping, singing and especially spending time with his family and grandchildren.  Steve is survived by his loving wife of 37 years, Teresa; his father, Clifford Fleming, Coldwater, Michigan; Step-mother, Marion Fleming; Coldwater; three sons, Nathan (Kristy Nelson) Fleming, Aurora, Aaron (Kelsey) Fleming, Spread Eagle, Matthew (Danielle) Fleming, Iron Mountain; four brothers, Bill Fleming, Coldwater, Michigan, Jack (Debbie) Fleming, Jackson, Michigan, Marty (Kathie) Fleming, Sagola, Michigan, Greg (Lisa) Fleming, Tekonsha, Michigan; one sister, Melinda (Micah) Fleming, Portland, Oregon; one brother-in-law, Scott (Martina) Corless, Germany and their children, Kelly Sue and Justin; seven grandchildren, Addison, Olivia, Jolie, Meira, Chloe, Taylor, Alizabeth; and one expected grandson arriving in November; four special nephews, Andrew (Christy), David (Sara), Sgt. Benjamin (Katie), and Lucas (Amber), and many other nieces and nephews.  Steven was preceded in death by his mother Thelma and one nephew Thomas Scott Fleming. Visitation will be Saturday, September 7, 2013, 12:00 p.m. to 2:00 p.m. at the Jacobs Funeral Home, Iron Mountain.  A celebration of life service will be held Saturday, 2:00 p.m. at the funeral home.  Pastor Steve Petry will officiate. Burial will be in Aurora Township Cemetery. Memorials can be made to the Aurora Rescue Squad or Unity Hospice, 2366 Oak Ridge Cir, De Pere, WI 54115.  You may light a candle in remembrance of Steve, or leave a condolence for his family online at www.JacobsFuneralHomes.com  The family has chosen the Jacobs Funeral Home, Iron Mountain, to honor Steve’s Legacy of Life.
data.text:
Sharing a Photo

This section allows the family to upload their own photos of the deceased.

Note: All photos must be approved by the funeral home or family before they will be available to the public.

Step #1 - Navigate to the "Share" tab at the left, and then "Upload a Photo". Note that photo file must be either jpg or png files only.

Step #2 - Click on the "Add files..." button.

Step #3 - Select the photo file from your computer and click "Open".

Step #4 - You'll see a preview thumbnail of the selected photo. You can enter a description of the photo in the field to the right of the preview. may add more files at this point. Once your photos have been selected, click on "Start Upload".

Step #5 - You can add more files at this point. Once you have selected the photos and entered a description, click on "Start Upload".

Step #6 - You'll see a message stating that your photos have been successfully uploaded and there will be a display of "My Uploaded Photos".

Step #7 - The photo will either immediately load into the Book of Memories or become available once approved by the family/funeral home.

The Book of Memories™ for your loved one is a permanent archive, so feel free to return at any time in the future to add to the collection of photos and stories.
